intro: Leontice chrysogonum, commonly known as golden ragwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has a fibrous root system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
